headline: TAP Q1 Earnings Call: Molson Coors Addresses Macroeconomic Pressures and Strategic Adjustments
summary: Beer company Molson Coors (NYSE:TAP) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, with sales falling 11.3% year on year to $2.3 billion. Its non-GAAP EPS of $0.50 per share was 37.2% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: TAP Q1 Earnings Call: Molson Coors Addresses Macroeconomic Pressures and Strategic Adjustments

headline: Fevertree and Molson Coors to split cost of US tariffs
summary: Fevertree also said that Charles Gibb, its North America CEO, will step down and be succeeded by Judd Hausner, who brings extensive experience from the U.S. beer network.  The British company, known for its premium cocktail mixers, counts the United States as its largest market, where it continues to deliver strong momentum bolstered by its partnership with the U.S. beer maker Molson Coors.  In January, Molson Coors took a stake in Fevertree, securing exclusive rights to distribute and market the British company's cocktail mixers and tonic waters in the U.S.

headline: Reflecting On Beverages, Alcohol, and Tobacco Stocks’ Q1 Earnings: MGP Ingredients (NASDAQ:MGPI)
summary: As the Q1 earnings season comes to a close, it’s time to take stock of this quarter’s best and worst performers in the beverages, alcohol, and tobacco industry, including MGP Ingredients (NASDAQ:MGPI) and its peers.
